entity_mention.mention_text: the first black Air Force General
a Naval Aviator who also served in the Gulf of Tonkin Yacht Club on the Hancock 68-69 and then the Connie (75-77)

a place in which the cold dead hand of French colonialism had recently been defeated by a Communist movement that clothed itself in the rhetoric of nativism and nationalism and which had been steeled by years of combat
the former colonial empires of our European mentors
Commander Amphibious Forces Pacific, (COMPHIBPAC) Flag Office
a generation notable mostly for its narcism and self-indulgence
much of a generation notable mostly for its narcism and self-indulgence
